name: resident
text:
A boner waggled in every direction is the same as...
...a boner waggled in no direction at all.

-Harry Nilsson.

name: thegoblins
text: A boner must be waggled in someone's direction to be in any way efficacious.

name: edd36
text: Even if it's being done furiously?

name: redphillip
text: It can, at times, be rewarding to waggle one's boner for one's own enjoyment (which I suppose is in one's own direction), and can be thoroughly efficacious.

name: thegoblins
text: well,  I'm by no means the boner expert.

name: octafish
text: Don't worry, redphillip is boner fide.

name: edd36
text:
Hmmm, I find this line of thought intrigueing. We have a number of propositions here: a boner waggled in all directions has low (or no) effectiveness. Waggled at one person has some (unquantified as yet) effaciousness. Waggled at yourself has some also undefined effaciousness. What is the optimal number of people (at what quantity does effaciousness begin to decline)? Should yourself be removed from the calculations as it is the base state and allways applicable? Is it a linear relationship (personally I doubt it)?

This my friends calls for SCIENCE. Nay, it calls for RIGOUROUS SCIENCE.

name: farqussus
text: intriguing science.

name: edd36
text:
After some preliminary testing I believe I have made a discovery that may shock society to it's core. Firstly I believe the optimum number of people a boner should be waggled at is between one and two (not including the waggler). If this was not an important enough discovery here is the truely shocking part. Negative waggling is possible! In fact specifically NOT waggling a boner at a person can be more effacious than waggling one at a large number of people. However this drops off rather sharply, more than one or two people specifically not being waggled at swiftly makes the exercise devoid of meaning.

Results:

[IMGS OFF]

name: edd36
text: However I'm sure not all variables are currently being taken into account. Waggling under certain circumstances has definately produced negative results which are not present on the graph. But we are close ladies and gentlemen. Together we CAN solve this!

name: edd36
text:
Ray assisted throughout the testing process. Hell yes he can still sport wood.

[IMGS OFF]

name: aperson
text: You forgot to put a scale on your graph! You failed and are in a lot of trouble.

name: edd36
text: That's intentional. I don't want any of you STEALING MY WORK and then passing it off as your own. For the scale you have to wait for the completed research to be published. The unscaled graph however gives a general view on my findings.

name: thegoblins
text:
"more than one or two people specifically not being waggled at swiftly makes the exercise devoid of meaning." So if there are three or four people you'd like to waggle your boner at, you should waggle it at between one to three of them in order to ensure you'll get the one not waggled on?

I would also posit that a male waggling his boner at people is not very likely to get many results/ propositions of marriage. Which is what it's all about.

name: hedonismbot
text:
My wife would disagree with you.

So would many other guys' wives that I've waggled at

name: mr-siegal
text: Really? I thought we were just filling in time waiting for a new strip.

name: lateadopter
text: I thought it was the hokey pokey.

name: edd36
text: Ah yes, well that is a thing indeed. But you must remember these tests were conducted under the most favourable of conditions.

name: history
text:
I also disagree...waggling within the correct context leads directly to marriage.

Without offense, I counter-posit that you just have not had the correct waggler or dimensions of waggling yet.

name: redphillip
text:
We clearly have different understandings of the purposes of boner waggling. In my experience marriage is almost never the sought after result, though on occasion some sort of continuing relationship may have followed in train.

I also think edd36's results are entirely too preliminary to support conclusions at this time. I suspect that inadvertent sampling bias has skewed the results reported. There is perhaps an ecology of boner waggling that admits to greater variation than that implied in edd36's initial surveys. What is without doubt is that much more science needs to be applied to the question -- rigorous, furious science.

name: belgand
text: Folsom's coming up. I suspect that all the data we shall ever need regardng boner waggling can be compiled there.

name: redphillip
text: This is true, in part.  Folsom will provide many research opportunities, and were I on the West Coast I would certainly devote myself to to some furious science.  I do caution, however, that Folsom alone is still inadequate for the purposes of our inquiry.  Though it is hugely significant to our understanding of boner-waggling ecology (not unlike the great migrations of caribou or wildebeest), relying on those vast numbers will introduce an enormous sampling bias and distort our results.  Further field work at Saturnalia-like festivals (Carnival, Mardi Gras, etc.) will be crucial for a comprehensive study.

name: lateadopter
text:
Back on the arrow thing, in your world...

Did the Indians fight the cowboys with bow and penis?

Does the song go,
"Wherever we go, everyone knows
It's me and my penis"
?

Does the penis of time point in only one direction?

Is a road with no bends straight as a penis?

Is an honest person a straight penis? And what does that say about Bill Clinton?

If you have more ideas to offer, do you have one more penis in your quiver? And if you have both a penis and a quiver, are you confused?

Did William Tell shoot the apple off his son's head with his penis? At how many paces, 'cause, day-amn! And how many years of therapy were needed after that?

Do you think the Plymouth Penis was an unpopular car because it was too small?

name: choco
text:
there *CAN* be an edit button, daidai... it would work like this:

With this hypothetical assetbarrista script, each post would have a unique/random serial number at the end of it. The assetbarrista script would NOT display the serial number, because who wants to see that crap.

Each post would have an edit option.
Chubby Lame Mark as Spam Edit *Ignore User*

When you edit a post, Assetbarrista would actually make a new post. The new post would have a code that tells Assetbarrista NOT TO DISPLAY the old post. The old post would be referenced via it's serial number. The Assetbarrista script would also verify that the person whose post is retracting the old post is the same person who made the old post, so as to prevent anyone from manually creating posts which retract/edit other posts.

As such, you could edit posts as many times as you like. Unfortunately, anyone not using assetbarrista would see each revision of the post.

Also, Assetbarrista could be used to keep track of your milk and egg inventory. Again, this would have the downside of creating a lot of posts which look like the internals of an excel spreadsheet, but only people not running Assetbarrista would see these posts. Of course the milk and egg inventory data would have to be encrypted to keep prying eyes out of your milk and egg business.

I dig that assessment. But the character development has been the thing that's driven that show for me since the first episode. And that's why I'm struggling with it now. So much of the new stuff seems contrary to everything that's been established.

Like Father Mickey drinking again. That was the most flimsy bullshit they've ever done. Teddy was a different story but with Mickey, it's like they put a drink in his hand for the sake of a joke.

That being said, the musical episode was hilarious.

text: Teaching Philippe to blow a bubble, Philippe's hair cut, Philippe and Lie-Bot and the skeleton in the closet, anything with Philippe, Ray enjoying a glass of milk old school style and about 5 other strips before and after that one, drawing a Nintendo, too many to remember.  So don't ask.

text: I never realized till now how odd a normal Achewood sentence like "Cartilage Head is killing Roast Beef" sounds to the layperson.

name: stonecrab
text: I hear ya! I tried to tell my husband (who refuses to read comics) about this great story arc... He just kept saying, "WHAT? WHO? WHAT? WHO?"  I said forget it, you sound like an owl.

name: kotoku
text: It can be so hard sometimes.

name: jean-paul
text: Nothing good EVER happens in Ray's SUV. NOTHING!

name: kotoku
text: Roast Beef goes in there to vomit.

name: plummet
text: The moral of the story is that SUV's suck and bring misery to all who own them.

name: neonfreon
text: A comment left by neonfreon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, CygnusX-1, daidai, professorhazard, anticitizen, sardoniclaconic, Scorpio_nadir, Stonecrab, Epicurus, eidolem)

name: daidai
text:
Dude, whining is the coolest schtick ever.

im so jealous of you i want to be your apprentice

name: plummet
text: Protip :If you get really good at it you can become as awesome as woodenteeth

name: i_love_kate
text: Whoa, huge slam on woodenteeth out of nowhere!

name: i_love_kate
text: Which incidentally results in splintering most of the time so, y'know. Watch out for that.

name: woodenteeth
text: Do I have a Reputation? Wait. What? I'm confused.

name: mr-siegal
text:
You certainly do!

Guard it like an aussie batsman guards his stumps.

name: mr-siegal
text: Sorry

name: mr-siegal
text: Have to share the misery.

name: stereo
text: Shouldn't be too difficult... the English can't pitch.

name: mr-siegal
text: They pitched a good line the other day.

name: mr-siegal
text: and they're poms, not english!

name: aperson
text: It's called 'bowling'. And for your information, the English bowled a whole bunch of touchdowns against Australia just recently in an important cricket game.

name: daidai
text:
important cricket game

oxymoron

name: edd36
text: Cricket embodies the most important past time of many cultures in it's purest form. Sitting around for 5 days of the summer drinking beer while a few guys do sport nearby.

name: thegoblins
text: You shouldn't give a damn about your reputation, grrrrl

name: belgand
text: TheGoblins has just discovered Joan Jett. What will this mean for the rest of Assetbar?!?

name: octafish
text: ...another dime in the jukebox?

name: woodenteeth
text: No really, can anyone help me out? I seem to have missed someone's Ignored post that was a huge slam on me out of nowhere.

name: belgand
text:
It's not hard, you could just search for your name, but I shall do the proper thing and relate the sordid tale for you now.

Quote:
daidai » neu 4 days ago
Dude, whining is the coolest schtick ever.

im so jealous of you i want to be your apprentice


Quote:
plummet » neu 4 days ago
Protip:If you get really good at it you can become as awesome as woodenteeth

name: woodenteeth
text: I have Plummet on Ignore. For this and many other reasons. My ego remains intact.

name: thegoblins
text: Plummet updates: he's still kind of a dick, but he wants to bone my face now.

name: woodenteeth
text: He's such a Romantic. Unless he has some kind of weird tribal "pointing the bone at you so you die" thing going on.

name: thegoblins
text: I went from crazy toothsome face to normal smiling face and suddenly he decided I'm not ugly after all. Happy day!

name: woodenteeth
text: Well well... the disease was inside him after all.

name: belgand
text: This is why I rarely ignore people. I might miss slams by people whose opinion I disregard and that I will probably barely even read.

name: neonfreon
text: onstad took bailout money to make this strip

name: cmr
text: RAYPHASIA

name: professorhazard
text: It took me forever to catch that Pokémon.

name: professorhazard
text:
Why on Earth did I think I could get away with using the accented E?

/buries it in the backyard to the catcalls of imagined angry peers

name: notcool
text:
There are no angry peers, Professor.

We've all been there. We've all seen the Assetbar Elephant.

name: hedonismbot
text: How could you put on such airs?!

name: thegoblins
text: I read this as angry peters.

name: edd36
text: Someone seems to have a bit of an obsession with furious ding-dongs at the moment...

name: altdelete
text: Today's "Fuck You Friday" is brought to you by OnStar%u2122.

name: deus
text: THIS IS WHAT HAPPENS WHEN INSURANCE CONTROL EVERYTHING!!!

name: epicurus
text: Something tells me that the "Voxopathic voice analysis software" is actually just the phone agent rolling her eyes.

name: deus
text: You probably wont feel that way tomorrow.

name: ozacrot
text: I am so happy for Wernicke's aphasia. Less so Beef's impending demise. [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wernicke%27s_aphasia]

name: ozacrot
text: Oh Look Who Effed Up URLs On His First Post

name: rowboat
text: I can't think of a better time to do it.

name: srikamaraja
text: I was going to say something about Broca. To save someone from a mistake is a gift of Paradise. Thank you.

name: chubbied
text: Comment left by chubbied ignored.

name: granularsilica
text: WE CAN DENY ANYTHING

name: wingspan
text: NO WE CANNOT!

name: daidai
text: THE BEING YOU CALL GOD IS NOTHING BUT AN OMNISCIENT BUNDLE OF WHEAT WRAPPED IN UNCOOKED BACON

name: thing
text: what

name: re5urgam
text: what

name: deus
text: Excuse me?! I'm what?

name: hedonismbot
text:
Tiiiiiin Roof


Rusted.

name: deus
text: what?

name: hedonismbot
text: Ain't no country I ever heard of

name: deus
text: i...uh...i better log off before i get disorientated.

name: slodowy_slicer
text: And now I'm imagining Jules quoting dramatically from the song to which you were referring.

name: deus
text: I DONT WRAP MYSELF IN BACON!!!

name: deus
text:
Someone doubting its me he's refering to?
Check your latin dictionary!

name: noooo_oo_oo
text: Still denying.

name: deus
text: A POX ON YOU!

name: troy_convers
text: Perhaps you shoulda chose that other classic non-used username, 'No status, no class.'

name: smallblackdog
text: further comment is superfluous

name: anticitizen
text:
why they got to go with "malformed ID" there?

"This links to the Chang & Ang of the internet. Point & stare, children. Point & stare."

name: thegoblins
text: There are many, many worse malformations than Chang and Ang's conjoint body.

name: choco
text: smallblackdog was intending to link to this

name: smallblackdog
text: I thank you - have a chubby!

name: savythomas
text: i wish i had a knife that grows as i walk.

name: miaou
text: My basal nervous system wants these knives!

name: plummet
text:
I think my heart's explodin'
THESE KNIIIIIIIIIVES!

name: ishuta
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: starchybunker
text: perhaps the only thing more gratifying than the sight of a drawn wrecked Escalade is the sight of an actual wrecked Escalade. After the Land/Range Rover, the conveyance of choice for utterly irredeemable douchebags, at least here in the Tri-State Area.

name: indoorsman
text: Range Rovers aren't douchebag conveyances, they occupy pride of place on Top Gear's COOL WALL!

name: farqussus
text: you just contradicted yourself

name: indoorsman
text:
EEEEEAUGGGGGHHHH!

PUKE

EEEEEAUGGGGGHHHH!

name: crunky
text: A comment left by crunky was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by gladi8orrex, edd36, anticitizen, farqussus, AdroitCelerity, puguglypress)

name: yknurc
text: A comment left by yknurc was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by AdroitCelerity, Stonecrab, Kotoku)

name: puguglypress
text: AAAAAaaanyway, Achewood has been really good lately, right!

name: joshuagross
text: A comment left by joshuagross was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Stonecrab, Kotoku, Dallovich)

name: puguglypress
text: Chubbied only to make up for the lames drawn by your obvious sarcasm.

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Was it Contrary Sunday? I must have missed that.
Hello, Little Big Man. I am not sorry!

name: rustmouth
text: well this oughtta clear up Ray's epilepsy...

name: pordo
text: I believe we should agree that Onstad is the best man in the world.

name: i_love_kate
text: I agree that we should believe that the best man in the world is Onstad.

name: granularsilica
text: In the online comic world?

name: thegoblins
text: In the world comic, online.  In the Internet of the Universe.

name: sherief
text: I think that the numbers at the end of Ray's sentences are him assigning a points-value to how excellent his non-sequiturs are.

name: kotoku
text: Well then none of them were the best, because if they were ray would have awarded them six hundo.

name: sherief
text:
Eight hundred!
for being probably right.

name: kotoku
text:
I would get strange looks if I went around pricing things like Ray does.

I wonder who lamed my remark on hundos? :O

name: plummet
text: CH NO!  The chopped vinegar and paper will upset Beef's stomach something fierce, and he will die after his digestive systems go into a fearsome, fatal paroxysm!

name: sherief
text: This statement is straight up WRONG.

name: belgand
text: I just learned that a female cat is technically known as a "Molly", much in the way that an unneutered male is known as a "Tom". It seems quite likely that Onstad may have been aware of this. To think that I never knew....

name: belgand
text:
Sorry man, I held out as long as I could, but 6:30 AM isn't exactly Monday night. I didn't even do the pissy thing and bring it up after midnight or even 3 AM, I waited it out 'til dawn and still nothing.

I'm just gonna go fix myself up a vinegar and paper, put the jasmine in the bedroom, and settle down for a nap. It's become too much for this dude.

name: fattybeaver
text: I hope the next one isnt taking forever becuase he is drawing more elaborate wallpaper for gumby.

name: choco
text: A comment left by choco was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ppccd, Stonecrab, hardelicious)

name: choco
text: weren't ^ready to be^ married

name: stereo
text: Jesus, choco. I'm starting to wonder why I didn't ignore you. Don't be that guy .

name: edd36
text: I think it's meant to be a joke, problem is there's been all too amny in the past who said stuff like this and meant it...

name: choco
text: why does it matter if I mean it or not?  Why do I have to mean it?

name: hardelicious
text: Who wants to bet "Monday around Lunchtime" ends up being "Wednesday, Very Late?"

name: aperson
text: Aw who cares.

name: lucidz
text: I think Onstad eats lunch very late.  Its 6pm est.

name: awesome_dude
text: I can just hear the sound of Cartilege Head's foot steps, it's the sound of a marble sphere striking a hardwood floor every two and a half seconds
